definition: ascending colon (anatomy)/first section of large intestine
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the retina cecal-ascending colon continent urinary reservoir.
sentences.chinese: 目的评价去带可控盲升结肠膀胱术的应用价值。

sentences.english: Always better to start with the right leg as it presses the ascending colon directly.
sentences.chinese: 最好从右脚开始练习，因为它直接地按升结肠。

definition: descending colon (anatomy)/third section of large intestine
transverse colon (anatomy)/second section of large intestine
sigmoid colon (anatomy)/bent colon, linking the descending colon to the rectum
iliac fossa (anatomy)/pelvic basin internal to ilium
jejunum (empty gut, middle segment of small intestine between duodenum 十二指腸|十二指肠[shi2 er4 zhi3 chang2] and ileum 回腸|回肠[hui2 chang2])
